properties.description: Recorded Future Identity Connector enables access to the Recorded Future Identity Intelligence. The connector has dedicated actions for search and lookup of identity leaks.

info.title: Recorded Future Identity
info.description:
The Recorded Future Identity Intelligence Connector enables security and IT
teams to detect identity compromises, for both employees and customers. To
do this, Recorded Future automates the collection, analysis, and production
of identity intelligence from a vast range of sources. Through this
connector, organizations can incorporate identity intelligence into
automated workflows (e.g., password resets) with applications such as Azure
Active Directory and Microsoft Sentinel.

post.summary: Credential Lookup - Look up credential data for one or more users
post.description: Look up exposed credential data for a specific set of subjects

200.description: Returns detailed information on the exposed credentials

clear_text_hint.description: First two letters of the exposed secret. Only available for secrets exposed in clear text

dumps.description: List of data dumps in which the signature has been involved.

breaches.description: List of data breaches related to the dump

description.example: Evony.com reportedly suffered data breaches in June and August 2016, resulting in the exposure of over 34 million user accounts.

site_description.example: Evony.com is the website of Evony LLC, which develops browser and mobile-based online games.

description.example: This credential data was derived from stealer malware logs. These logs were obtained through Recorded Future\u2019s proprietary sources.

downloaded.description: Date when the dump was downloaded

exposed_secret_format.description: Format of the exposed secret. Either the hash algorithm or clear for cleartext.

first_seen.description: Date when the signature was first seen exposed

last_seen.description: Date when the signature was last seen exposed

malware_family.title: Malware family
malware_family.description: Family of malware used to extract the credentials

secret_hashes.description: List of known hashes of the exposed secret. Calculated by Recorded Future if the secret was exposed in clear text.

secret_rank.description: Any common password collections the password is part of

403.description: Provided token is not authorized to use the API.

post.summary: Credential Search - Search credential data for one or more domains
post.description: Search credential data exposed in data dumps and through malware logs

items.title: Domain
items.description: A domain owned by your organization

200.description: Returns a list exposed credentials related to the searched domains

credential_dumps.title: Credential dumps
credential_dumps.description: List of credentials exposed in data dumps

malware_logs.title: Malware logs
malware_logs.description: List of credentials exposed through malware logs

next_offset.title: Next offset
next_offset.description: Offset used to request succeeding records

403.description: Provided token is not authorized to use the API.

metadata.title: RFI-add-EntraID-security-group-user
metadata.description: This playbook adds a compromised user to an EntraID security group. Triage and remediation should be handled in follow up playbooks or actions.

releaseNotes.title: Updates
notes: Solution update. Change PlaybookName prefix to RFI.

metadata.title: RFI-confirm-EntraID-risky-user
metadata.description: This playbook confirms compromise of users deemed 'high risk' by EntraID.

releaseNotes.title: Updates
notes: Solution update. Change PlaybookName prefix to RFI.

metadata.description: Name of the logic app connector which performs Recorded Future Communication. Normaly this dont change from RFI-CustomConnector-0-1-0

body.reason: Failed to save Lookup results into LogAnalytics.

body.status: Successfully saved risky user lookup results into LogAnalytics table.

metadata.title: RFI-lookup-and-save-user
metadata.description: This playbook gets compromise identity details from Recorded Future Identity Intelligence and saves the data for further review and analysis.
prerequisites: The custom connector RFI-CustomConnector-0-1-0 have to be deployed under the same subscription.

To use the Recorded Future for Azure connector, you will need a valid API token from Recorded Future as described in the [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/connectors/recordedfuturev2/#how-to-get-credentials)
postDeployment: After deployment, open the playbook to configure all connections and press save.

releaseNotes.title: Updates
notes: Solution update. Change PlaybookName prefix to RFI.

releaseNotes.title: Identity endpoint update
notes: Updated lookup envpoint to new version. Structure of data in the lookup_results_log_analytics_custom_log_name

If_Credential_dump_exposure_is_new.description: "New" - means it have not been previously seen by the Logic App.

If_Malware_log_exposure_is_new.description: "New" - means it have not been previously seen by the Logic App.

Current_time.description: This block is needed only to create 3 branches in this For each loop.

Initialize_-_Array_of_known_Credential_d.description: Existing Credential dumps (collected during prior Logic App runs)

Initialize_-_Array_of_known_Malware_log_.description: Existing Malware logs (collected during prior Logic App runs)

Initialize_-_Array_of_new_Credential_dum.description: "New" - means that this are new leaks, which weren't seen on previous runs of the logic app.

Initialize_-_Array_of_new_Malware_log_ex.description: Exposures that wasn't previously seen by the Logic App.

Initialize_-_Array_of_transformed_new_Cr.description: New Credential dumps are formatted to enable storing and comparing them with existing Credential dumps in Log Analytics.

metadata.title: RFI-search-workforce-user
metadata.description:
This playbook searches the Recorded Future Identity Intelligence Module for compromised workforce users.

This playbook depends on:
- RFI-add-EntraID-security-group-user
- RFI-confirm-EntraID-risky-user
- RFI-lookup-and-save-user

 Those playbooks need to be installed **manually** before installing current playbook.

releaseNotes.title: Updates
notes: Added subscriptionId as a parameter and updated solution to match V3. Change PlaybookName prefix to RFI.

If_Malware_log_exposure_is_new.description: "New" - means it have not been previously seen by the Logic App.

Current_time.description: This block is needed only to create 3 branches in this For each loop.

Initialize_-_Array_of_known_Malware_log_.description: Existing Malware logs (collected during prior Logic App runs)

Initialize_-_Array_of_new_Malware_log_ex.description: Exposures that wasn't previously seen by the Logic App.

metadata.title: RFI-search-external-user
metadata.description:
This playbook searches the Recorded Future Identity Intelligence Module for compromised external (customer) users.

This playbook depends on:
- RFI-add-EntraID-security-group-user
- RFI-confirm-EntraID-risky-user
- RFI-lookup-and-save-user

 Those playbooks need to be installed **manually** before installing current playbook.

releaseNotes.title: Updates
notes: Added subscriptionId as a parameter and updated solution to match V3. Change PlaybookName prefix to RFI.

releaseNotes.title: Updates
notes: Added Log Analytic Workspace as a parameter.

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: Please refer to the following before installing the solution:

Review the solution Release Notes

There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

Recorded Future Identity Intelligence enables security and IT teams to detect identity compromises, for both employees and customers. To do this, Recorded Future automates the collection, analysis, and production of identity intelligence from a vast range of sources. Organizations can incorporate identity intelligence into automated workflows that regularly monitor for compromised credentials and take immediate action with applications such as Azure Active Directory and Microsoft Sentinel. There are many ways organizations can utilize Recorded Future Identity Intelligence; the playbooks in this Solution are just a quick introduction to some of those ways. In particular, these playbooks include several actions that can be coordinated, or used separately. They include:

  1. searches for compromised workforce or external customer users
  2. looking up existing users and saving the compromised user data to a Log file
  3. confirming high risk Azure Active Directory (AAD) users
  4. adding a compromised user to an AAD security group

For more information, see the Documentation for this Solution.

The playbooks have internal dependencies where you have to install:

  • RecordedFutureIdentity-add-EntraID-security-group-user
  • RecordedFutureIdentity-confirm-EntraID-risky-user
  • RecordedFutureIdentity-lookup-and-save-user

Before:

  • RecordedFutureIdentity-search-workforce-user
  • RecordedFutureIdentity-search-external-user.

This solution depends on underlying Microsoft technologies. Some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs:

  • Log Analytics
  • Logic apps

Custom Azure Logic Apps Connectors: 1, Playbooks: 5

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
